sentences.sContent: His fingerprints were all over the gun.
He was careful not to leave any fingerprints .
The police questioned Beresford and took his fingerprints (= made a record of them ) .
sentences.sCn: 警察审问了贝雷斯福德，并提取了他的指纹。

phrases.pCn: DNA指纹；DNA指纹图谱（等于genetic fingerprint）
指纹技术；指纹法（蛋白质分析）

remMethod.val: finger(手指) + print(印迹) → 指纹， 手印

trans.tranOther: a mark made by the pattern of lines at the end of a person’s finger, which is used by the police to find out who has committed a crime
